Alert

Contextual feedback messages with a set of variations to suite messages with some type of intention. For the most basic alert use the pam-Alert attribute.

Default styling

Title

Callout message

info
This is not important but may need your attention.

Title

Callout message

success
Congratulations! You have successfully done something.

Title

Callout message

warning
Wow! You better take a look this needs your attention!

Title

Callout message

danger
Oh no! That did no go so well get another pair of glasses and try again.

Title

Callout message

Markup

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup 

<div pam-Alert="[modifier class]">
    <h1 pam-Alert-Heading>Title</h1>
    <p>Callout message</p>
</div>

Header

pam-Alert-Heading keeps headers in check in a alert context.

Header

Alert with a header can come in handy...

Markup

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup 

<div pam-Alert>
    <h2 pam-Alert-Heading>Header</h2>
    <p>Alert with a header can come in handy...</p>
</div>

Link

pam-Alert-Link is a sub-object that adds contextual colors for links.

This alert has a awesome link!
Markup

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup 

<div pam-Alert>
    This alert has a <a pam-Alert-Link href="#">awesome link!</a>
</div>

Close

pam-Alert="closeable" Adds styling for closeable alert by expanding the right padding and make place for the close icon position.

Eyy! This alert can be terminated, awesome!
Ã
Markup

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup 

<div pam-Alert="closeable">
    <strong>Eyy!</strong> This alert can be terminated, awesome!
    <div pam-Close="right">Ã</div>
</div>

Fully loaded

Combine alert sub-objects and throw in a color modifier to create a fully loaded alert!

Fully loaded!

Oh yeah, all alert features closeable, header and link.

Well, that's just crazy!

Ã
Markup

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup 

<div pam-Alert="closeable">
    <h2 pam-Alert-Heading>Fully loaded!</h2>
    <p><strong>Oh yeah</strong>, all alert features closeable, header and link.</p>
    <p>Well, <a pam-Alert-Link href="#">that's just crazy!</a></p>
    <div pam-Close>Ã</div>
</div>

Callout

This variation of alerts has a more emphasized styling and is a alternative way to draw attention to information.

Default styling

Title

Callout message

info
This is not important information, carry on.

Title

Callout message

success
Something was successfully done!

Title

Callout message

warning
Yes, this is something to pay attention to!

Title

Callout message

danger
That went sideways!

Title

Callout message

Markup

Toggle full screen Open in new window Toggle example guides Toggle HTML markup 

<div pam-Alert="callout [modifier class]">
    <h1 pam-Alert-Heading>Title</h1>
    <p>Callout message</p>
</div>

Hooks

.hook-alert .hook-alert-callout .hook-alert-callout-danger .hook-alert-callout-info .hook-alert-callout-success .hook-alert-callout-warning .hook-alert-danger .hook-alert-heading .hook-alert-info .hook-alert-link .hook-alert-success .hook-alert-warning
